alert.note: Alert for Little River (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 8:50AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL LITTLE RIVER... SOUTHERN MCCURTAIN...NORTHWESTERN BOWIE AND RED RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 930 AM CDT... At 850 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Manchester, or 22 miles north of Clarksville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Foreman, Boxelder, Idabel, Winthrop, Arkinda, Bagwell, Manchester, Valliant, Avery, Millerton, Annona, Haworth, Garvin, Moon, Beaverdams, Goodlake, Shinewell, Woodland, and Redland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
